channel.title: Azure Functions on Yoichi Kawasaki
channel.description: Recent content in Azure Functions on Yoichi Kawasaki

item.title: Quick Start with Azure Functions V2 Python (Preview)
item.description: Today (Sept 25, 2018 JST), Azure Functions supports Python development using Python 3.6 on the Functions v2 (cross-platform) runtime. You can now use your Python code and dependencies on Linux-based Functions. This is an article on quick start with Azure Functions V2 Python (Preview) showing how you can quickly start Python function development on Azure Function V2 runtime. 1. Prerequisites for Buidling & Testing Locally Python 3.6 (For Python function apps, you have to be running in a venv) Azure Functions Core Tools 2.
